Title: Cortical inputs to the CA1 field of the monkey hippocampus originate from the perirhinal and parahippocampal cortex but not from area TE
Abstract: We determined the cortical regions that project directly to the CA1 field of the monkey hippocampus by injecting the retrograde tracers Fast blue, Diamidino yellow or WGA-HRP into CA1 and examining the distribution of labeled cells. In the temporal lobe, large numbers of retrogradely labeled cells were observed in the perirhinal and parahippocampal cortices. Only an occasional labeled cell, however, was observed in the unimodal visual area TE. Additional projections to CA1 arose in the dorsal bank of the superior temporal sulcus, in the rostral and retrosplenial portions of the cingulate cortex, in the agranular insular cortex, and in the caudal orbitofrontal cortex.

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Region_Parcellation: Perirhinal cortical areas 35 and 36, parahippocampal areas TF and TH
@BrainMaps_Delineation.Comments: In figures 1-3 the borders of areas 35-36, TF, and TH are shown by different shades of gray.

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Comments: There is no information, from which parcellation scheme the different subvisions of the hippocampal formation (see Figs. 1-3)  have been adopted.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The cytoarchitectonic organization of the perirhinal and parahippocampal cortices has been described previously [1, 3]. The border between areas 36 or TF and the laterally adjacent area TE is not sharp. The transition between areas 36 or TF and area TE appears to have characteristics intermediate between them and we have labeled this area (36 or TF)/TE in Figs. 1 and 2." (p. 44)

@InterMapRelations.Comments: We assume that entorhinal cortex of SA90 equals the entorhinal cortex of IAC87a, because (i) D.G. Amaral is an author of both papers and (ii) SA90 has already adopted the parcellation scheme of IAC87a for the perirhinal and parahippocampal areas.

We assume that the inferotemporal area TE of SA90 equals area TE of IAC87a, because (i) D.G. Amaral is an author of both papers and (ii) SA90 has already adopted the parcellation scheme of IAC87a for the perirhinal and parahippocampal areas.

We assume that the parcellation scheme for the hippocampal and subicular areas of SA90 equals that of WA91, because (i) D.G. Amaral is an author of both papers and (ii) the nomenclature is the same in both papers.

@InterMapRelations_clean.Citation: "The injection in experiment M-7-89 was confined to CA1 of the caudal hippocampus and was focused in stratum lacunosum-moleculare (Fig. 1)"

@Methods.Comments:
"A library of 5 experiments with injections of the retrograde tracers Fast blue (FB) or Diamidino yellow (DY) into various fields of the hippocampal formation were available from a previous study [10 (Witter et al., 1989)]. The two tracers were injected on both sides of the brain at different rostrocaudal levels of the hippocampal formation and thus 20 injections were available for analysis.
In three additional experiments, discrete injections of the retrograde tracers FB, DY, or WGA-HRP were placed into different rostrocaudal levels of the medial portion of the CA1 field of the hippocampus." (p. 44)

@Injections.Citation: "In M-2-87, (Fig. 2) the injection was somewhat smaller than in M-7-89 and was located rostrally in CA1." (p. 47)

@Methods_Animals.Comments:
It is not explicitly stated which monkey species were used, but it is said that the experiments were adopted from the experiment in WVA89 (Witter et al., 1989).
In that work both macaca mulatta and macaca fascicularis were used.

@Injections.Comments: The text says that the injection was confined to hippocampal area CA1. It should be noted that figure 1 shows in ambiguous way the location of the injection site, which seems to cross a border.

@LabelledSites_Data.Comments: There were 4095 labeled neurons in the inferotemporal cortex and 2914 labeled neurons in other cortical areas (p. 47).

@Methods_Animals.Comments:
It is not explicitly stated which monkey species were used, but it is said that the experiments were adopted from the experiment in WVA89 (Witter et al., 1989).
In that work both macaca mulatta and macaca fascicularis were used.

publication.title: Cortical inputs to the CA1 field of the monkey hippocampus originate from the perirhinal and parahippocampal cortex but not from area TE
publication.abstract: We determined the cortical regions that project directly to the CA1 field of the monkey hippocampus by injecting the retrograde tracers Fast blue, Diamidino yellow or WGA-HRP into CA1 and examining the distribution of labeled cells. In the temporal lobe, large numbers of retrogradely labeled cells were observed in the perirhinal and parahippocampal cortices. Only an occasional labeled cell, however, was observed in the unimodal visual area TE. Additional projections to CA1 arose in the dorsal bank of the superior temporal sulcus, in the rostral and retrosplenial portions of the cingulate cortex, in the agranular insular cortex, and in the caudal orbitofrontal cortex.
